page.title: 06EDUCATION.
page.content: Apart from a small percentage of children who attend private schools within the county,the majority of children receive their schooling at local state schools.Bishampton no longer has a village school and therefore the children have to journey to Flyford Flavell which is approximately 2.5 miles away.The system of education within this area is organised under the middle school system.From the age of 5 years to 9 years the children attend Flyford Flavell first school.They then,at the ages 9 years to 12 years attend the middle school St.Nicholas,Pinvin and thereafter conclude their schooling at the high school known as Pershore High School.The first school numbers approximately 70 children.The middle school 250 children in number and the high school,about 1100.
